physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 64-year-old woman with upward gaze restriction of 25%, slight restriction of downward gaze, marked bilateral contraction of the frontalis muscles during attempted eye opening, no rigidity or tremor, normal gait with slight retropulsion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial inability to open eyelids worsened over 3 years; marked improvement after treatment with L-dopa.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 26-year-old man with anarthria, clumsiness, headache, facial diplegia, weakness in both arms, paresis of both upper limbs, limb ataxia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms developed acutely after intrathecal chemotherapy, then gradually improved with leucovorin.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 59-year-old man presented with recurrent respiratory infections and decreased serum globulin levels from 26 g/L to 12 g/L.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Panhypogammaglobulinemia developed 13 months after starting lamotrigine treatment, reversed after stopping medication.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 46-year-old woman with myasthenia gravis experienced joint pain and stiffness correlated with pyridostigmine intake.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms disappeared entirely after cessation of pyridostigmine; patient remained pain-free after 4 months.
